content.text:
I've seen this "discussed" in other communities, but I think the #scuttleverse might *actually* be capable of talking about this without devolving into a flame war: do you take any positions on the following?

- Operating system: #unix, #gnu, #linux, #linux-libre, #gnu/linux, ...
- Licenses: #bsd, #mit, #gpl, #copyleft
- Philosophies: #opensource, #open-source, #freesoftware, #foss, #floss, ...
- Organizations: #osi, #fsf, ...

I've always used the term "Linux", favored permissive licenses, and used the term "open-source", but I've slowly been learning more about the history of free and open source software. I imagine I'm not the first person to dive into this political minefield, so I'd love input from others who are more familiar and have already thought their way through the maze.
